trial_identification.studytitle: Predicting Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes (PAPO) Study: An observational study to determine factors in both male and female partners to predict healthy pregnancies and adverse pregnancy outcomes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Predicting Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes (PAPO) Study: An observational study to determine factors in both male and female partners to predict healthy pregnancies and adverse pregnancy outcomes

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Fetal medicine and complications of pregnancy

interventions.interventions: Dietary, lifestlye, genetic and circulating (blood) factors will be observed once before pregnancy (if posible) and again at 12 weeks gesation in the mother. Fathers will have blood taken only at one time point. Pregnancy Outome data will be collected within 6 weeks of particpants giving birth.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pregnancy outcome data will be collected from the volunteers medical records
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of delivery or pregnancy loss

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) damage levels will be measured in lymphocytes using the cytokinesis block micronucleus (CBMN) assay.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: One time point before pregnancy (the couple must be actively trying to get pregnant) and at 12 weeks gestation

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Blood concentrations of folate, vitamin 12, homocysteine and enzyme polymorphisms within folate metabolism. These tests will be done by SA pathology using routine laborarty tests.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: One time point before pregnancy (the couple must be actively trying to get pregnant) and at 12 weeks gestation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Recruit before 12 weeks gestation, Consent to participate
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Serious medical illness, lack of informed consent

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC)

fundingsource.fundingname: National Health and Medical Research Council (NHMRC)

othercollaborator.othercollaboratoraddress: 72 King William Road, Adelaide South Australia, 5006

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Investigating possible causes or predictors of adverse pregnacy outcomes.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Children, Youth and Women's Health Service (CYWHS) Human Research Ethics Committee
